result.execSummary:
The defendant Jarod Luke Petersen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jarod Luke Petersen is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jarod Luke Petersen was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sixty days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts. Submit DNA sample. Counts 2 & 3 dismissed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jarod Luke Petersen

Plaintiffs Motion and Demand for Discovery and Notice of DNA and Witness List filed by ADA Peggy Crooks Mishacoff
Copy of discovery letter to Atty Peter Middleton from ADA Peggy Crooks Mishacoff
notice of completion of representation filed by Atty Middleton
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed by Attorney Peter Middleton

10:07 AM Cases called: 21CF101, 20CF625, and 22CF369. Prosecuting attorney Peggy A. Crooks-Mishacoff in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jarod L. Petersen in court.  Attorney Melville Peter Middleton II in court for Jarod L. Petersen. Agreement recited by State. Court reviewed the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 1 of 20CF625, count 1 of 22CF369, & count 2 of 21CF101. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. Counts 2 & 3 of 20CF625 dismissed. Counts 1 & 3 dismissed. Sentencing statements. In 22CF369, court sentenced the defendant to serve 30 days in jail, with Huber. $443.00 costs. Submit DNA sample. Sixty days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts. Jail start 8-2-22 at 7 pm. 14 days credit. In 20CF625 & 21CF101, court withheld sentencing, placed the defendant on probation for 36 months. Conditions of probation include: Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia. Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations. Comply with any treatment recommended by agent. Submit DNA sample. Costs of $518.00 each case. In 21CF101 3 days credit. In 20CF625 6 days credit. 10:24 PM
for Preservation of Evidence filed by Atty Middleton

Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia. Standard felony conditions.

1:38 PM Cases called: 22CF369, 21CF101, and 20CF625. Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jarod Luke Petersen appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Allison J Borsheim appeared by video for Jarod Luke Petersen. Waived reading of complaint. Advisement of rights.  In 21CF101 and 20CF625 reason for the missed appearances given. Bond recommendations. In 22CF369 Court set $500.00 cash bond. Standard felony conditions. Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. In 21CF101 $1000.00 cash bond, and 20CF625 Court set $10000.00 cash bond. Warrants are quashed. In 20CF625 it will be put back on for trial. 1:45 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 02:10 pm.
Return date scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
